messages.title: The Facts
messages.content:
1. Nicola Sturgeon has said she will count every vote for her at this election as a vote for another independence referendum - and she says she wants to hold that referendum as early as next year.
2. Jeremy Corbyn has said he won't stand in the way of another independence referendum and the LibDem leader has refused to rule out working with Labour.
3. So it's clear - everyone who wants to stop another independence referendum being held needs to lend their vote to the Scottish Conservatives at this election. There's no other way to stop Indyref2 - and this could be our last chance.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Scottish Conservatives are against holding another independence referendum.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Nicola Sturgeon, Jeremy Corbyn, LibDem leader
mentions.tacticalSituation: Everyone who wants to stop another independence referendum being held needs to lend their vote to the Scottish Conservatives at this election. There's no other way to stop Indyref2 - and this could be our last chance.

Corbyn could back new indyref 'as early as 2021'.
